justification: "At the end of the experiment, participants responded to the Comprehensive Thinking Styles Questionnaire (CTSQ) (Newton et al., 2023)" indicates that overall thinking style was assessed with the CTSQ.
The paper discusses correlations involving "actively open-minded thinking" and notes that these data came from the Comprehensive Thinking Styles Questionnaire completed by participants.
The exploratory results link "preference for effortful thought" to behaviour, implying this construct was measured via the CTSQ administered to participants.
A positive association with "preference for intuitive thought" is reported, and this sub-scale originates from the Comprehensive Thinking Styles Questionnaire used in the study.

The methods section states that participants completed the "Cognitive Reflection Test (CRT) (Thomson & Oppenheimer, 2016; Frederick, 2005)", establishing the CRT as the measure of cognitive reflection.
